poem:
**Kissing the Markets**

Beneath the weight  
of tariffs and bluster,  
leaders bow to commerce,  
the currency of praise  
turned coin in hand—  
an artless exchange.  
The world shifts,  
unseen,  
as a carnival of words  
masks the chaos  
of gold  
traded for the wind.
